critique: This document pertains to the annexation of the Hawaiian Islands and the enforcement of Chinese Exclusion Laws. It directs the Secretary of the Treasury to transfer funds for these purposes. Ideologically, the enforcement of Chinese Exclusion Laws reflects a conservative stance at the time. Immigration is strictly restrictive, aligning with closed borders. Executive power is somewhat expanded as the funds are to be expended at the discretion of the Executive. Federalism is strong as it involves federal control over immigration in the Hawaiian Islands. National security is not a primary focus, but the enforcement of immigration laws touches upon it. Economic regulation is not directly addressed. Social inclusion is negatively impacted due to the discriminatory nature of the Chinese Exclusion Laws.
